page.title: 18Llandudno Lifeboat (contd)
page.content: It is 11.28m long, 3.51m wide and weighs 10.668 tonnes. Maximum speed 8.5 knots (11 mph). If it overturns, a powerful pump rights the boat in 6 secs. A large, powerful, caterpillar tractor, fitted with hardwood blocks to prevent damage to road surfaces, pulls the boat to the launching site - we can feel the vibration when it goes past. The crew of 7 are called to the station by flare (day) and by phone or bleepers (night). All are volunteers and 5 live in town. There were 32 rescues in the year 1984-5, 10 by the Lilly Wainwright(which can carry 65 persons) and 22 by the inshore craft. Quickest time from station to launch - 8 mins (high tide),16 mins (low tide). The lifeboat is so important to Llan- dudno because some of the large number of tourists do no heed warning signs and good advice when in the water.
